newsitem.title: USA: CSCE to lower margins on July "C" coffee futures.
newsitem.headline: CSCE to lower margins on July "C" coffee futures.

text.p: Coffee, Sugar and Cocoa Exchange said Monday it will lower the margin on the July "C" coffee contract to $9,000, including a $3,000 spot charge, effective June 24.
The current margin required for the July 1997 contract is $10,000, including a $4,000 spot charge.
The margin on all other coffee contracts will remain unchanged, the exchange said in a statement.

The change comes less than a week after the exchange lowered the July margin by $2,000, to $10,000. At that time, the September "C" coffee margin was decreased to $8,000, including a $2,000 spot charge and the margins on all other contracts were lowered to $6,000.

In addition, straddle or arbitrage transactions for customers who are CSCE members or members of the trade will require a minimum of $1,000, down from $1,500. However, the $3,000 spot charge for July 1997 is applicable to all straddle and arbitrage transactions involving this contract month.
For customers who are not exchange members or a member of the trade, margins will be 140 percent above trade rates, CSCE said. ((--Patricia Avidan, New York Commodities Desk, 212 859 1640))
